website_summaries.verdict: The Pebble 2 doesn't win on fitness tracking, but it's still a solid pick for simple notifications and messages on a long-battery budget smartwatch.
pros: Improved software makes glancing at quick notifications easier
Built-in microphone for quick text message responses
cons: Baked-in fitness tracking is uneven, especially heart rate and workout tracking
Small black and white screen is sometimes hard to read
Pebble's apps and watch face options are often ugly

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for, Low Profile smart watch
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a slim low profile smart watch with long battery life and the ability to display what is written in a text or instant message. This watch does that plus extra features. Weather alerts, pedometer, sleep tracking, calories and alerm features. As of now the app market still functions. At first I had issues installing the update, but I left the house and ran the update strictly on my phone's data and it went through while driving. It's a quite simple smart watch, I like this product more than my Samsung and Motorola smart watches.
customer_reviews.author: K, Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: The buttons are great for switching music or volume while jogging, bicycling or riding motorcycle without having to look down. It's exactly what a smart watch should be without the extra bloatware that higher priced watches have. The battery lasts all week and the screen is always on. This is my second pebble. My Pebble One still works great but after 3 years with it I figured it was time for an upgrade. The microphone on the Pebble Two works great and makes sending quick text messages so much easier. I'm very pleased and I highly recommend this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Hector

customer_reviews.title: Design + Funtionality + Practicality
customer_reviews.text: 9 months into ownership and daily wearing of the Pebble 2 SE and I wish I had bought a second one in the event it gets stolen or broken. This is everything you could really want in a smartwatch. Great visibility outdoors, great battery life, interfaces flawlessly with Android phones, easily configurable to "sleep" notifications, AND when it's low on battery, it drops Bluetooth and becomes just a regular watch until you make it to your charger! I charge this every 7 days but have pushed it to 9 days. Fitbit purchased Pebble but does not offer a similarly designed smartwatch in their catalog. There is a market for eInk, function-over-bloat, weekly charging, mid to small form factor smartwatches.

customer_reviews.title: From a 5 star to zero

I have done everything suggested on Pebble forum and read the reviews and see that this has happened to others. I change my review to no stars since the company exists no longer. My bad. I knew that when I bought it. Had I gogtten a year of wear out of it I migh not complain but 5 months is not long enough.

customer_reviews.title: Get 'em while you can!
customer_reviews.text: This watch is perfect for me. It connects easily to my iPhone (6s), has great battery life (about 5 days or so), is waterproof (can be worn in the pool), and the available apps are very useful. Essential for me, as a teacher, are the phone and text notifications-- I can glance at my watch to see who's calling or texting, without having to take out my phone. The only complaint that I have is that Pebble was bought by FitBit, which is scrapping it. Poor decision to do so, as the Pebble, while perhaps not for everyone (it's not flashy, doesn't have a touch screen, is B&W), fills a niche very well. I am very happy with it!

customer_reviews.title: Mini phone
customer_reviews.text: It's a toss up between this and a fitbit. Honestly this is more like a phone on your wrist. It does weather, time, steps, sleep, notifications, quick reply, etc. The fit bit does about half of these + heart rate, but has a more in depth app for tracking fitness over all. Get this one if you just like having a mini phone on your wrist. Get a fitbit if you're interested in health tracking.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great watch
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent watch as it does everything I need it to. I owned the first generation Pebble watch until it went out on me. This one is slimmer and sleeker looking and the battery lasts much longer (it's been five days since it's last charge and I'm still at 60% battery). It's unfortunate that Pebble is no longer making these or providing any support, but I still believe it is a great value for the price. As a bonus, I received it in 2 business days even though I selected the standard free shipping (ordered on Saturday, came in on Tuesday). So far, I am happy with this product.

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect no-frills smartwatch!
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect no-frills smartwatch! Water resistant, extremely long battery life (several days without charging), display is easily readable in any lighting condition, and the list goes on. I wanted a smartwatch to count my steps and give me notifications without touching my phone..and this thing does that plus more. I love how i can reply to texts using simple words, emojis, or my voice! It's also really convenient that there's buttons to control this watch because touchscreens can be annoying sometimes.

customer_reviews.title: Incredible improvement over my Pebble 1
customer_reviews.text: It's a shame there won't be any more Pebbles because this is an amazing device. I caved in and bought it when Amazon dropped it to 50% off even though my Pebble 1 was fine, but this is better in every way. Smaller profile, fantastic battery life, better support for animations, sleep tracking, step counting, multiple vibration patterns for notifications, and the voice to text actually works really well! Well worth it
